name: Strange Vintage Fictions (book)
description:
SALE!! Was $22.95!!

This may well be one of the strangest books you'll want to own. Take a journey back in time to an alternate reality where charmingly creepy characters exist comfortably within crumbling walls, where bugs are beautiful and mystery is around every corner. Each page is full of strange images from the mind of HaggisVitae, the alter ego of artist Julie Miller. Meet Starboy of the Oceans Blue, Tobias Waddlecrock and his unreasonably large insect friends, a pair of avian hats who refuse to get along, a supreme whirling dervish master who writes Haiku--to name but a few. Fall down this beautifully illustrated, full-color rabbit hole and find you never want to return. If you love illustrated novels, the charming darkness of Tim Burton, the wit of Edward Gorey, the object lessons of The Brothers Quay, then you might just enjoy this journey into humor, madness, magic, mayhem and a rather large dollop of science-y goodness. Pour a cup of tea and get ready for a very odd adventure. And away we go!</BR> </BR>

"you have grabbed an aspect of the fictioneer's art, magnified it, and inflected a whole fresh set of art fictions from it. Three practioners of this magus-engineering come to mind: Borges, Nabokov and W.G. Sebald: makers of the has been, might have been and , with the right sidereal conjunctions-- would have been." ~N.C. Mallory, Artist/Writer

Paperback: 104 pages, full color throughout
Publisher: L.T. Godsmith Press (September 5, 2011)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 0983821240
ISBN-13: 978-0983821243
Product Dimensions: 11 x 8.5 x 0.2 inches

More information can be found at haggisvitae.com

name: The Girl Who Read To Birds (Book)
description:
WAS $14.95!!

The Girl Who Read To Birds, a fantasy novel written by Michael Titus and illustrated by Julie Miller, is a modern fairy tale about Avery Street, an eccentric 12-year old girl whose greatest delight is reading to birds -- crows, ravens, wrens; the birds are all too eager to hear tales inspired by the human imagination. Avery is a misfit child, to her parents, teachers and classmates. Her struggle is to hold her ground, survive the conventional world, and keep herself terribly alive in a place where true magic is said to exist only in books, not in real life. 

This is a tale of courage and of being proud of your differences and true to yourself. 

How far would you go to follow your dreams? 

Suitable for age 10+ (adults love this book as well!)

The Girl Who Read To Birds is a full-color, lushly illustrated book that will be treasured by young and old alike. (for more information see TheGirlWhoReadToBirds.com)


Paperback: 60 pages, FULL COLOR illustrations throughout
Publisher: L.T. Godsmith Press (August 9, 2011)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 0983821208
ISBN-13: 978-0983821205
Product Dimensions: 8.5 x 8.5 x 0.2 inches

name: Lower Deadhorse Festival - Set of 5 postdards
description:
Set of 5 postcards of my original HaggisVitae piece entitled "The Lower Deadhorse Fall Festival And Nonchalant Balancing Competition of 1892." Perfect for the lover of the odd, the Tim Burton fan, the devoted E. Gorey admirer. 

Postcards are printed by a professional printing company on heavy card stock with a glossy finish. The back is blank and free to do with as you please.

name: New Year's Raven - set of 5 postcards
description:
Why not keep in touch with your friends and relatives with this HaggisVitae Strange Vintage Fictions original image on a set of 5 professionally printed postcards.

Printed professionally on glossy 4.25 x 5.5" card stock. The back is free for you to do with as you see fit!

SHIPPING IS FREE ON THIS ITEM within the U.S.

name: Guardian - set of 5 postcards
description:
This is one of my best selling images. A vintage dark-winged boy sitting atop a stack of gorgeous old books. It's a photomontage creation I did a few years back and now you can have it in postcard form. Why not send a note to a long lost friend or family member, or surprise someone you see all the time with REAL, true mail. I miss it myself. Yes, they still make stamps!

This listing includes 5 - 4.25 x 5.5" postcards. The back is set up for addressing and writing your special note.
